### **IV.a. Students will describe applications of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies in library and information science.**

**LIS 6511 - Collection Development and Maintenance\
My Hypothetical Queens Public Library**

I referred to the Queens Public Library (NY) for my assignments that utilized (real and fabricated) qualitative and quantitative data to assess community needs, build a more balanced collection, and develop a collection policy.

**LIS 6271 - Research Methods in Library and Information Science\
A Proposed Study on the Effects of Prioritizing Diverse Material\
in a Public Library's Book Displays (group project)**

With a literature review focused on increasing circulation of materials based on high-traffic locations in a library and applying a mixed-methods approach to gathering data, our group proposed displaying diverse materials in a public library and collecting survey and interview responses from patrons to better understand the factors of their choices.
